Hello everyone! I don’t know if anyone has used the template sections already, but I was wondering if there’s a way to not use the dnd rows and columns inside of it. Meaning that I could link the module as if I were on a template like so `{% module 'title' path='../modules/header.module' %}`

I’ve been trying to scape from the dnd areas and sections because it makes everything easier for devs, but in this case I don’t know if there’s a workaround to avoid this. Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

I’ve got an issue on the drag and drop pages. I have a fixed global header on my site, when trying to edit the section below I’m unable to select it as the header gets in the way. Is there a known fix for this? I’m having to right-click inspect and delete the header so I can get to the section options. I can’t tell my client to do this as its not user friendly.
If you click on the editor panel on the left it should work… Or maybe I’m not understanding fully the issue.
